items.to_string:
Value Statement: As a member of the Gen-Ann tenant team, I want to use Grafana to monitor desired metrics for the Gen-Ann App. There are certain queries and metrics in the Grafana dashboard that are unclear or can be improved. They should be updated.

Acceptance Critera: -Review queries and clarify difference between DailyHighlights and BedrockInvocationCount - Find the correct query design that allows tracking of Cost Metrics by monthly timeline - Provide Query-Metric mapping from Lambda - Update transformation functions such that date information can be rendered in the desired format.

**Value Statement:** As a platform engineer, I want the core API foundation migrated from Python to Go so that I can test basic functionality locally and validate the performance improvements.

**Assumptions:** - Current Go project structure in bip-crossplane-manager will be the foundation - Local testing environment can be established with existing Kubernetes access - Core routes include /, /config, /health, and basic authentication middleware.

**Acceptance Criteria:** - Given the Go API server when I start it locally then it responds to health checks - Given a request to the root endpoint when authenticated then it returns API metadata including version and environment - Given a request to /config when authenticated then it returns the same configuration format as the Python API - Given any authenticated request when processed then user authentication works via existing OAuth2 proxy headers - Given the core middleware when implemented then CORS, logging, and authentication are properly handled - Given the basic route structure when established then it follows the documented pattern in STRUCTURE.md - Given the Kubernetes client integration when tested then it can successfully connect to the cluster.

**Definition of Done:** - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit + integration) - Documentation updated in README - Local development environment setup documented - Authentication middleware tested with sample requests - Basic route structure established per STRUCTURE.md / ROUTES.md - Go modules and dependencies properly configured.
This issue is cloned by BIP-28552

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI team member who monitors tenant activity and resource usage in the development environment, I need the ability to create Grafana alerts for tenants in dev that reference applicable AWS service quota limits so that we can proactively identify and address potential overages before they impact system performance or tenant operations.

Acceptance Criteria: -When a tenant’s resource usage approaches or exceeds applicable AWS service quota thresholds, the Grafana alert triggers a notification to the nonprod Slack channel-. - When quota information is unclear or outdated, the team collaborates with solution engineers to confirm applicable limits before finalizing alerts. - When alerts are implemented, they are validated through simulated over-quota conditions, and documentation is updated for alerting configuration reference.

As a BIP AI engineer, I want to host a training session that covers the different pipeline configurations available within Harness, so that I can teach the various ways to configure, customize, and optimize pipelines for my team’s deployment and automation needs. AC: Schedule and announce a training session focused on Harness pipeline configurations. Prepare an agenda covering pipeline basics, branching strategies, approval flows, triggers, stages, and integration options.

As a member of the BIP-AI team, I want to collaborate with the systems team to set up account-level user group mappings in Harness, so that we can control which users are permitted to execute deployment pipelines for dev, stage, preprod, and prod environments across tenant projects. AC: Meet with the systems team to review requirements for user groups and their environment mappings. Systems team creates the following account-level user groups and mappings: bip-dev-ai-admins → bip-ai-dev-pipeline-executor bip-stage-ai-admins → bip-ai-stage-pipeline-executor bip-preprod-ai-admins → bip-ai-preprod-pipeline-executor bip-prod-ai-admins → bip-ai-prod-pipeline-executor Confirm that the mappings enforce correct execution permissions for each environment type. Ensure BIP-AI team has access to manage user group membership and pipeline execution policies going forward. Validate that tenant teams retain dev pipeline access, while BIP-AI controls stage, preprod, and prod pipeline executions.

Value Statement
As a BIP AI Tenant who manages SageMaker endpoints, I need the test to the automation of the kill endpoint lambda which terminates idle endpoints based on their last inference request so that I can validate the kill endpoint script

Acceptance Criteria
When a SageMaker endpoint has been idle (no inference requests) for a configurable period, the Lambda function terminates the endpoint.
The Lambda function logs terminated endpoints and their last activity timestamps for audit purposes.
The Lambda function can be scheduled to run periodically using EventBridge.
The Lambda function uses the boto3 library for SageMaker and logs actions to CloudWatch.
Validation
Test the Lambda function with endpoints that have varying levels of activity to confirm it correctly identifies and terminates idle endpoints.
Verify that logs include accurate details of terminated endpoints and their last activity.
Ensure the Lambda function can be triggered on a schedule using EventBridge.

items.from_string:
User Story: Add Deep Pause and Deep Resume Buttons to AllResources Vue Component
Title
Add Deep Pause and Deep Resume UI controls to Crossplane All Resources view for hierarchical resource management

Description
Extend the existing AllResources.vue component by adding two new action buttons for "Deep Pause" and "Deep Resume" functionality. These buttons will be positioned alongside the existing Pause and Resume buttons in the action bar and will utilize the new deep pause/resume API endpoints to enable administrators to pause/resume entire resource hierarchies with a single click. The implementation will follow the existing UI patterns and provide appropriate visual feedback during operations.

Value Statement
By adding Deep Pause and Deep Resume buttons to the All Resources UI, administrators can efficiently manage complex resource hierarchies through the familiar web interface, reducing the need for manual command-line operations and providing immediate visual feedback on bulk operations across resource trees.

Acceptance Criteria
• Two new buttons ("Deep Pause" and "Deep Resume") are added to the action bar in AllResources.vue • Buttons are positioned logically near existing pause/resume controls with consistent styling • Deep Pause button integrates with new /deep-pause-resource API endpoint • Deep Resume button integrates with new /deep-resume-resource API endpoint • Buttons follow existing disabled state patterns when no resources are selected or operations are in progress • Loading states display "Deep Pausing..." and "Deep Resuming..." text during operations • Success notifications display detailed results including counts of successfully processed resources • Error handling displays specific failures with resource names while continuing operation • Buttons maintain accessibility standards with proper ARIA labels and keyboard navigation • Visual styling matches existing button design patterns (colors, hover states, focus rings) • Button tooltips provide clear descriptions of hierarchical functionality • Selected resource count is displayed in button text following existing pattern • All notifications follow existing notification patterns and durations

Definition of Done
• Deep Pause and Deep Resume buttons are implemented and functional in AllResources.vue • API integration correctly calls new deep pause/resume endpoints with proper payload structure • Error handling gracefully manages partial failures and displays meaningful user feedback • Loading states and disabled states work correctly during operations • UI follows existing design patterns and accessibility standards • Component maintains responsive design on different screen sizes • Manual testing confirms buttons work with various resource selection scenarios • Code follows existing Vue 3 composition API patterns used in the component • No regression issues with existing pause/resume functionality

Technical Notes
Leverage existing pauseSelectedResources and resumeSelectedResources functions as implementation templates
New functions should be named deepPauseSelectedResources and deepResumeSelectedResources
API endpoints will be /deep-pause-resource and /deep-resume-resource
Follow existing button styling with distinct visual indicators (consider icons like "layers" or "hierarchy")
Maintain existing isOperationInProgress state management pattern
items.to_string:
Title: Develop deep pause API endpoint for Crossplane composite resources to enable hierarchical control

Description: Extend the existing pause/resume functionality by implementing a "deep pause" feature that allows administrators to pause a selected Crossplane composite resource and all of its child resources recursively. This backend functionality will programmatically traverse the resource hierarchy using composite resource references to identify and pause/resume all dependent resources in the chain. The implementation should leverage the existing pause/resume helper functions that handle the crossplane.io/paused=true annotation.

Value Statement: By implementing deep pause functionality, administrators gain the ability to quickly pause entire resource hierarchies with a single action, reducing operational complexity and potential for human error when managing complex composite resources with multiple dependencies.

Acceptance Criteria: 
• New FastAPI backend route is created for deep pause and deep resume operations 
• Function recursively identifies child resources using composite resource references 
• Deep pause operation traverses multiple levels of composite-to-composite relationships 
• Implementation utilizes existing pause/resume helper functions for individual resource annotation • Deep pause continues processing all resources even if individual resources fail to pause • Error handling reports specific resources that failed to pause/resume without stopping the operation 
• API response includes lists of successfully paused/resumed resources by plural/resource name 
• API response includes lists of failed resources with error details by plural/resource name 
• All operations (successes and failures) are logged for audit and debugging purposes 
• Deep resume operation reverses the pause state for all resources in the hierarchy 
• All resource types are included in deep pause operations (no exclusions) 
• Local testing is completed using Bruno API client against minikube cluster 
• Unit tests cover the recursive resource discovery logic and error handling scenarios 
• Integration tests validate end-to-end deep pause/resume functionality

Definition of Done: 
• FastAPI routes for deep pause and deep resume are implemented and functional 
• Recursive resource traversal logic is thoroughly tested 
• Error handling continues operation and reports failed resources appropriately 
• Response format includes detailed success/failure lists with resource identification 
• Comprehensive logging is implemented for all operations 
• All tests pass in local minikube environment 
• Bruno test collection is created and validates API functionality including error scenarios 
• Code is reviewed and meets team standards 
• Documentation includes API endpoint specifications, response format, and usage examples

Update Bedrock notebooks to use inference profiles for model invocation

Value Statement
As a BIP AI Tenant who runs Bedrock model notebooks, I need the ability to use inference profiles instead of model IDs so that model invocation aligns with platform standards.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user opens a Bedrock notebook, model invocation uses an inference profile (not a model ID).
Notebooks include comments explaining that inference profiles must be requested via a BIP AI support ticket.
Inference profile fields are set as empty strings by default.
Functionality is verified with an existing inference profile.

Title: Implement BIP-AI RBAC for tooling ArgoCD to allow management of applications Value Statement As a BIP-AI Infrastructure Engineer, I need to implement RBAC (Role-Based Access Control) for tooling ArgoCD, so that I can enable proper access management and security controls for application deployment and management within the BIP-AI platform. Description This story involves implementing comprehensive RBAC policies for the tooling ArgoCD instance to ensure proper access control, security boundaries, and operational governance for application management for BIP AI Infrastructure engineers. The implementation will follow security best practices and integrate with existing authentication and authorization systems. A/C: When I implement RBAC policies for tooling ArgoCD, then I need to: Define appropriate roles and permissions for different user types (developers, operators, administrators) Configure RBAC policies that align with BIP-AI security requirements Implement proper access controls for application management operations Follow existing RBAC patterns and conventions used in the BIP platform When I configure the RBAC integration, then it needs to: Integrate with existing authentication systems (OIDC, SSO) Support fine-grained permissions for different environments (dev, staging, prod) Enable proper application lifecycle management controls Restrict access based on user roles and project boundaries When I test the RBAC implementation, then it needs to: Successfully authenticate and authorize users based on their roles Properly enforce permission boundaries for application operations Handle different user scenarios (create, read, update, delete applications) Work correctly in ephemeral environment for validation When I validate the RBAC functionality, then it needs to: Demonstrate proper access control enforcement Show correct permission inheritance and role mapping Handle edge cases and unauthorized access attempts appropriately Maintain audit trails for access and operations Definition of Done: RBAC policies implemented and configured for tooling ArgoCD Integration with authentication systems completed Comprehensive testing performed in ephemeral environment PR created with approvals from Engineering team Documentation updated with RBAC configuration and usage patterns

The implementation will follow security best practices and integrate with existing authentication and authorization systems.

A/C: When I implement RBAC policies for tooling ArgoCD, then I need to: Define appropriate roles and permissions for different user types (developers, operators, administrators) Configure RBAC policies that align with BIP-AI security requirements Implement proper access controls for application management operations Follow existing RBAC patterns and conventions used in the BIP platform When I configure the RBAC integration, then it needs to: Integrate with existing authentication systems (OIDC, SSO) Support fine-grained permissions for different environments (dev, staging, prod) Enable proper application lifecycle management controls Restrict access based on user roles and project boundaries When I test the RBAC implementation, then it needs to: Successfully authenticate and authorize users based on their roles Properly enforce permission boundaries for application operations Handle different user scenarios (create, read, update, delete applications) Work correctly in ephemeral environment for validation When I validate the RBAC functionality, then it needs to: Demonstrate proper access control enforcement Show correct permission inheritance and role mapping Handle edge cases and unauthorized access attempts appropriately Maintain audit trails for access and operations Definition of Done: RBAC policies implemented and configured for tooling ArgoCD Integration with authentication systems completed Comprehensive testing performed in ephemeral environment PR created with approvals from Engineering team Documentation updated with RBAC configuration and usage patterns

Value Statement

As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who maintains the bip-ai-kit repository for internal and tenant usages, I need to replace "mlmats" with "bipai" in logging code so that the codebase and resources remains consistent with the new name.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user specifies a new CloudWatch with "bipai", logging continues to work and Grafana consumes correctly the logs.

Value Statement

As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who maintains the bip-ai-kit repository for internal and tenant usages, I need to replace "mlmats" with "bipai" in Jenkins files so that the codebase and resources remains consistent with the new name.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user kicks off a Jenkins pipeline using "bipai", the pipeline should not fail.

As an MLE I want to see if its possible to send user credentials to AWS to authenticate bedrock access

AC: Document with findings of if it's possible to do using AWS and Boto3

As an MLE, I want to define a hello world application for Playwright in order to demonstrate its capability.

AC: Create example Playwright workflow.

items.from_string:
Value Statement

As a BIP AI Tenant on the TERA team, I need the ability to receive timely support so that I can resolve issues and continue my work without unnecessary delays.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user from TERA requests support, the support team responds and assists as needed. Manual validation: Confirm support requests are tracked and resolved.
items.to_string:
Initiative:
AC: * Configure Slack alerts for BIP AI stable Jenkins build and deployment pipelines in PREPROD

Value Statement

As a BIP AI Tenant who is new to the platform, I need the ability to attend an introductory session so that I can understand platform features, workflows, and best practices to accelerate onboarding and effective use.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user attends the internal run-through, the session covers key platform features, workflows, and hands-on examples. The session agenda and materials are prepared and reviewed internally before the actual tenant session. Manual validation: Internal team completes a run-through and confirms readiness for the tenant session.

Value Statement As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who maintains platform code, I need the ability to review existing pytest coverage in key repositories so that I can identify areas needing additional automated tests and improve code reliability.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user completes the audit, they have a summary of current pytest coverage and identified gaps in the mlkit, tenant resources, and mlops template repositories. Recommendations for additional tests are documented and shared with the team. Manual validation: Review audit findings and confirm recommendations are actionable.
Testing (pytests) audit on relevant repos to identify areas needing additional automated tests and improved code reliability

Title

Update READMEs in bip-ai-kit, tenant resources, and bip mlops template repos for clear and up-to-date documentation Value Statement As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who maintains platform resources, I need the documentation in key repositories to be clear, intuitive, and current so that users can easily understand and use the resources without confusion.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user reviews the README in bip-ai-kit, tenant resources, or bip mlops template, the documentation is clear, accurate, and up to date. Outdated or unclear information is revised or removed. Functionality that will validate that this story is complete: Manual review confirms all README files are clear, intuitive, and reflect the latest platform standards.
Update READMEs in relevant repos to ensure clear and relevant documentation
